meanings.definition: Making or having a high-pitched sound
meanings.sent1: The toy car had a squeaky wheel.
meanings.sent2: The door hinges were squeaky and needed oiling.
meanings.sent3: The mouse made a squeaky noise as it scurried across the floor.
meanings.sent4: The old wooden floorboards protested with a squeaky creak.
meanings.sent5: The balloon made a squeaky sound when rubbed against the wall.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or producing a high-pitched sound
meanings.sent1: The squeaky violin played a sweet melody.
meanings.sent2: Her voice was so squeaky that it could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent3: The squeaky door handle always gave away her secret midnight snacks.
meanings.sent4: The squeaky brakes on the bike screeched in protest.
meanings.sent5: The squeaky toy delighted the playful puppy.

meanings.sent1: The mouse made a squeaky in the quiet room.
meanings.sent2: The squeaky of the rusty gate echoed through the night.
meanings.sent3: The classroom was filled with the squeaky of chalk on the blackboard.
meanings.sent4: The old house was full of mysterious squeaky in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The children's laughter mixed with the squeaky of the swing set.
